If you use a 9th level spell slot, the length can be up to 8 hours.

spell.name: Rigid Thinking
entries: Rigid Thinking can be cast only upon a creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher. The target creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or be subjected to the following effect.

A creature affected by Rigid Thinking is incapable of performing any action other than the activity they are involved in when the spell takes effect. The creature's mind simply cannot decide on another course of action--it becomes frozen into a single thought and cannot change even if new circumstances would suggest otherwise. Thus, a fighter fighting a kobold will ignore the arrival of a beholder, and a rogue picking a lock will pay no heed to the arrival of three guards.
An affected creature will not continue to fire their bow at a dragon if they run out of arrows, but will choose another means of attacking the dragon to the exclusion of all other activities.

A spellcaster in the process of casting a spell when Rigid Thinking takes effect will attempt to repeat the spell at the same target if possible, and if they don't have the resources to do so, they will then attempt to continue working towards their goal with other appropriate means.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end the spell. Otherwise, the spell expires when the target accomplishes their goal (i.e., the kobold is killed or the lock is opened) or when the spells duration ends.

spell.name: Lesser Telepathy

components.m: a small book with numerological markings

entries: You create a telepathic link between yourself and a creature within range with an Intelligence score of at least 5. If the creature is unwilling, it can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effect.

Until the spell ends, you and the target can can communicate silently and rapidly. Telepathy does not give either participant access to the other's thoughts, memories, or emotions. Participants can only "hear" the thoughts that the other participant actively "sends." Mind-to-mind communication is approximately four times faster than verbal communication. The level of complexity that can be communicated is only that which can be expressed through language. Gestures, expressions, and body language cannot be conveyed.

spell.name: Strength of One
entries: When casting this spell, the caster imbues up to two creatures out of a group of three (unincluding the caster) with a temporary Strength score equal to that of the strongest creature in the group. The caster can also be the one whos Strength score is shared if it possesses the highest score, but can still only affect two creatures. To be affected by the spell, all creatures must touch the hand of the caster at the time of casting. Only humanoid creatures of size Medium or lower may be affected.

Upon completion of the spell, all affected characters gain a Strength score equal to the Strength score of the creature with the highest score in the group. Any magical bonuses affecting the creature who's Strength is shared are not added; only the the natural Strength is conferred on the group.
This bonus supercedes any magical or other bonus an affected character would gain from a different source.

The spell ends if either the Strength sharing creature or the caster are {@condition incapacitated} or killed before the duration expires. The bonus and duration are not affected if a different member of the group is {@condition incapacitated} or killed within the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of creatures that can benefit from the spell is increased by one for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tree
entries: By means of this spell, the caster is able to assume the form of a small living tree or shrub or that of a large dead tree trunk with only a few limbs. Although the closest inspection cannot reveal that this plant is actually a person, and for all normal tests he is, in fact, a tree or shrub, the caster is able to observe all that goes on around them just as if they were in normal form. The Armor Class and hit points of the plant are those of the caster. The caster can remove the spell at any time, instantly changing from plant to his normal form and having full capability for any action normally possible (including spellcasting). Note that all clothing and gear worn or carried change with the caster.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is up to 1 hour. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is up to 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration is up to 24 hours. If you use a 7th level spell slot, the duration is up to 1 week. If you use an 8th level spell slot, the duration is up to 1 month. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the duration is up to 1 year.

spell.name: Unfailing Premonition
entries: By anticipating possible futures and outcomes of the caster's actions, this spell provides the character with a temporary sixth sense or feel for danger. The spell operates on a subconscious level, and for 10 minutes after casting the spell, the caster receives strong intuitive impulses when they contemplate courses of action that may bring immediate physical injury or harm to them. In addition, the caster has advantage on Dexterity saving throws for the duration of the spell.
For example, if the cleric was about to open a trapped chest, the unfailing premonition would create a flash of insight or a gut feeling telling them that they shouldn't do so.

Similarly, opening a door that leads into the lair of a ferocious troll may also trigger the spell's warning. Threatening a NPC who is likely to respond by drawing a weapon and attacking the PC would create a warning, but threatening a NPC who will get even with the cleric in an hour or two will not trigger the premonition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration of the spell is increased by 10 minutes for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Weather Prediction
entries: By casting this spell, the caster can predict the weather conditions at the current location for the next 24 hours. The caster becomes aware of the prevailing conditions, trends, and weather systems that may affect the current location.

Temperature, wind speed, cloud cover, and precipitation can all be predicted with 95% accuracy for the next day. Magical or supernatural phenomena cannot be predicted. Casters of powers concerned with weather may use this spell to determine the best time for certain ceremonies or observances. Other casters can find weather prediction useful for planning journeys or selecting campsites.

spell.name: Control Temperature
entries: When this spell is cast, the temperature in the area surrounding the caster can be altered by 100 C°, either upward or downward. The spell can be used to ensure the comfort of the caster and those accompanying in extreme weather conditions. The party could stand about in shirt sleeves during the worst blizzard (although it would be raining on them) or make ice for their drinks during a scorching heat wave.

The spell also provides protection from intense normal and magical attacks. If the extreme of temperature is beyond what could be affected by the spell (a searing blast of a fireball or the icy chill of a white dragon), the spell reduces the damage caused by up to 40 points individually for every creature inside the area of the spell. Normal saving throws are still allowed, and the reduction is taken before the saving throw is made. Once struck by such an attack, the spell immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of damage points the spell can mitigate is increased by 5 for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: When you cast this spell, a green ray springs from your outstretched hand and it unerringly strikes a creature within line of sight and the range of the spell. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the spell covers the subject with a shimmering emerald field that tethers the subject to that physical location for the duration of the spell.

The spell has two effects. Firstly, it completely blocks bodily extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred by the dimensional anchor include blinking, dimension door, etherealness, gate, misty step, plane shift, and other similar teleportation or psionic abilities.

Secondly, the spell tethers the target to the location it is in. If by any means the target moves over 20 feet away from the location where it was subjected to the spell, it is then pulled back to that location by the green tethers of the spell at the end of the turn on which is moved.

spell.name: Inverted Ethics
entries: This spell reverses the ethics of a person or group of people. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

While under the influence of this spell, a creature behaves in a manner opposite to the way they normally would behave. Thus, a shopkeeper influenced by inverted ethics will think it perfectly normal for someone to pick up an item from the shop and walk out the door without paying for it. If someone tried to pay for an item, the shopkeeper would be insulted. If the spell is cast on a shopper in a store, they would find it natural to steal the item, thinking that they are behaving in a proper way. If the spell is cast on a professed thief, they will no longer steal, choosing to pay for the goods instead.

Inverted ethics does not cause a creature to actively commit evil deeds (or good deeds). Thus, an affected creature will not go on a shoplifting rampage; it will steal only as the opportunity presents itself.

spell.name: Spell Immunity

m.text: emerald dust worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: By means of this spell, the cleric renders a creature touched immune to the effects of a specified spell of 4th level or lower for the duration. It can protect against spells, spell-like effects of magical items, and innate spellcasting abilities of creatures. It does not protect against breath weapons or gaze attacks of any type.

The spell has a few additional limitations. Firstly, the caster must have directly experienced the effect of the specified spell. For example, if the caster has been attacked by a fireball spell at some time, the caster can use the spell immunity spell to provide protection from a fireball. Secondly, only a particular spell can be protected against, not a certain school of spells or a group of spells that are similar in effect; thus, a creature given immunity to the lightning bolt spell is still vulnerable to a shocking grasp spell.

spell.name: Unfailing Endurance
entries: This spell, refered to by some as "magic meth", enhances the natural hardiness and stamina of the affected creatures by rendering them virtually immune to fatigue or {@condition exhaustion}, for a time. During the casting of the spell, the caster must touch each creature to be affected, and the spell can affect up to 5 creatures.

While under the spells influence, an affected creature does not need to sleep, nor do they suffer any negative effects from not sleeping. In addition, affected creatures can also force march for an additional amount of hours a day equal to their Constitution modifier, before they have to start rolling Constitution saving throws to prevent {@condition exhaustion}.

While the spell is in effect, affected creatures do not suffer the negative effects of {@condition exhaustion}, but they must keep track of the amount of {@condition exhaustion} they would accrue during that time otherwise. Once the spell ends, affected creatures immediately suffer half (rounded up) the amount of {@condition exhaustion} stacks that they would have accrued during the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration of the spell is increased by 1 day for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Othertime

m.text: an hourglass filled with rare salts, worth at least 100 gp

entries: When a cleric enters Othertime, they step into a different reality in which the world around is frozen at a moment in the future. Until time catches up, the cleric may move about unhindered and observe their surroundings; no force known can detect their presence or harm them in the alternate reality, although they in turn cannot affect any creature or object in the physical world. To the clerics companions or enemies in real time, the cleric appears to simply vanish altogether, only to reappear at some later point.

The amount of time the cleric can travel into the future for is up to 1 minute. The duration chosen by the cleric governs the length of the Othertime; if the cleric decides that the spell will last 2 rounds, then they are instantly transported to that point in time, surrounded by the frozen still-life of the world as it will appear 2 rounds after the cleric cast Othertime. The caster then has 2 rounds to themself to take any actions, although they cannot affect the real world by any physical, magical, or mental means. While the caster is in the Othertime, they are completely unaware of the intervening events.

spell.name: Memory Wrack

m.text: a ruby worth at least 100 gp

entries: This spell "disconnects" the subject's short-term and long-term memory. When affected by this spell, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is incapable of storing information in long-term memory for the duration of the spell.

Every moment is virtually an independent event for the target; it can remember recent events, thoughts, and sensations for no more than one round. Memories of events that happened before the onset of the spell are not affected at all; these are safely stored in long-term memory.

While the spell is active, the subjected target is forced to concentrate, as if on a spell, to be able to act. Spellcasters already concentrating on a spell when Memory Wrack takes effect are forced to drop that spell, and they can not cast a concentration spell for the duration of Memory Wrack's effect.

If the target takes damage and is forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, on a failed save the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn, at which point they can repeat the Wisdom saving throw to attempt to end Memory Wrack.
When the spell ends, the target remembers nothing that happened while the spell was in effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spells duration remains the same, but no longer requires concentration.

spell.name: Shrieking Walls
entries: This spell enchants any single room no larger than the area of effect. When any creature larger than a normal rat (larger than one-half cubic foot or weighing more than three pounds) enters the room, shrill shrieks begin to emanate from the walls. The shrieks persist for {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds. The walls do not undergo any physical change. The shrieks can be heard only by creatures inside the room. Creatures hearing the shrieks experience no ill effects on the first round, allowing them time to leave the room or cover their ears. Creatures who remain in the room during the second or subsequent rounds of the shrieks who have not protected their hearing are penalized as follows:

Creatures whose levels are greater than the level of the caster must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effects of the spell for 1 minute.

Creatures whose levels are less than or equal to the level of the caster become {@condition deafened} for {@dice 1d6} hours, and {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. Spellcasters {@condition deafened} by this effect have a 20% chance of miscasting any spell with a verbal component.
The effect of the spell persists for the duration of the spell no matter how many times the effect is triggered.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the duration becomes 14 days. With a spell slot of 7th level, it becomes 1 month. With a spell slot of 8th level, it becomes 1 year, and with a spell slot of 9th level, the spell lasts until it is dispelled.

spell.name: Thoughtwave
entries: Thoughtwave allows the cleric to send a short but powerful message to one or more specific individuals anywhere on the same plane of existence, informing them of the casters situation and general location. The spell instantly generates a powerful mental impulse indicative of the caster's general mental state--anger, fear, pain, despair, etc., in addition to a message up to twenty-five words in length.

The caster can designate as many as ten people to receive this message, provided they can all be specifically named or grouped in a general category. If more than ten individuals are in a designated group, those closest to the source will receive the impulse.

Creatures receiving the impulse automatically know who sent it (even if they have never met the cleric before) and gain a clear indication of the mood and situation of the caster. Recipients also intuitively know the general source of the spell, although they are unable to pinpoint rooms, dungeon levels, or landmarks.

spell.name: Creeping Shadow

components.m: a small statuette of the caster sculpted from a piece of coal

entries: This spell causes the casters shadow to elongate, stretching away from their body at a rate of up to 30 feet per round, up to a maximum distance of 120 feet away. When creeping shadow is cast, and on each of the casters turns afterwards, the shadow stretches in a direction designated by the caster. The shadow can only travel on a physical surface, but it can move up walls and other structures and objects.

Creeping shadow can not be cast in darkness; at the very least dim light is required. The shadow itself makes no sound, and is generally difficult to spot. The shadow can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A small and medium sized caster creates a 5-foot wide shadow.

The shadow can not physically touch, pick up, or attack creatures or objects. The shadow can be attacked, but only by spells, magical effects, and magical weapons. The shadow has an AC equal to the caster, and if the shadow is attacked, the caster loses hit points.

While the spell is active, the caster can see, hear, and speak through the shadow. Wherever the shadow stretches, it creates difficult terrain for anyone standing in its area. At any point while the spell is active, the caster can use a bonus action to seep down into their shadow, and reappear at any point along the elongated shadow, teleporting to that location and rising up from the ground the shadow is covering. Teleporting in this way ends the spell.

spell.name: Moderate Restoration

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 30 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature and mend them with a moderate amount of positive energy. You can reduce the target's {@condition exhaustion} level by one, or you can remove one effect causing a target to be {@condition frightened}.

spell.name: Permanency

m.text: platinum dust worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell affects the duration of certain other spells, making the duration permanent. The wizard casts the desired spell, and then follows it with the permanency spell. Permanency can not be cast on creatures, it can only be cast on items, objects, or areas no larger than 10 cubic feet. Permanency cast on items or objects only impart the magical effects to those touching, holding, or wearing the item or object, while permanency cast on areas affects everyone and everything in the area.

Permanency can only make certain spells permanent. Firstly, the spell being made permanent must have a duration of at least 1 minute. Secondly, the spell must be one that does not require a direct interaction between two or more creatures. Thirdly, the spell can not be one which normally ends once triggered or when a certain condition is met (excluding concentration). If a spell seems ambiguous when it comes to meeting these requirements, the DM has the final say on if it can be made permanent.

When cast at 5th level, only 1st level spells can be made permanent. Platinum dust is the material component for the spell, and the amount of platinum dust needed increases when the spell is cast at higher levels. The amount of gold needed in platinum dust equals that of 10 times what is needed for a spell scroll of equal level.

Permanency is vulnerable to anti-magic effects, and the dispel magic spell. When a dispel magic is cast on an object affected by permanency, the combined spell levels of the permanency spell and the spell made permanent are added to the DC, as is the spellcasters level at the time of the casting of permanency.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the level of spell that can be made permanent increases by one for each slot level above 5th. The material component cost increases as well, as explained in the spell description.

spell.name: Burning Rush

time.condition: which you take in response to being damaged by a melee attack that you can see

entries: Fire streaks out of your feet for a moment, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily struck by flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
As part of the reaction, you can also move up to an amount equal to half your movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Drain Life
entries: You extend your hand, and attempt to draw the life energy from a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends. On a failed save, you begin siphoning life energy from the target, dealing damage and healing you. Roll {@dice 3d6}, and choose which of the dice heal you, and which of the dice deal necrotic damage to the target. You must heal with at least one die, and you can not heal with more dice than what you deal damage with.

On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to automatically repeat the effect on the target creature as long as you are within range and line of sight when doing so. If you do not spend an action continuing this spell every turn, it ends. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spells range or if it has total cover from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of dice rolled increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Death Coil
entries: A horrifying visage of dark energy is unleashed from your hand at a creature in range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and is forced to immediately use its reaction, if available, to flee as far as its speed allows in a direction indicated by the first of the {@dice d8}'s rolled (1 is up, and subsequent numbers go clockwise.) The creature doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit.
On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't have to move.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Soulburn
entries: You ignite the soul of a creature within range, and the combustion wreathes the target in flames. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell's duration.
At the end of each of its turns, the burning target must repeat the Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one.

Any other creature that moves within 5 feet of a burning target or starts it's turn there must also make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature also catches fire and is subjected to the spells burn effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6}, and the burn damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dark Bargain

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by a damaging attack

entries: A sinister shield of dark magic surrounds you when you are hit by an attack. When the shield appears, it has {@dice 2d6} hit points. Whenever you take damage, the shield takes the damage instead, and the shield has resistance to all damage. If damage reduces the shield to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.
At the start of your next turn, the shield dissipates, and you immediately suffer the same damage the shield took earlier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the shields hit points increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Devouring Plague
entries: You attempt to afflict a disease upon a creature that you can see within range which slowly eats away at it's body, and transfers some of that creatures life to you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target is unaffected and the spell ends.

On a failed save, a plague begins to rapidly eat away at the flesh of the target. Once per turn, the plague deals {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage to the target when you hit it with an attack. If the {@damage 1d4} deals damage below the maximum die amount, you also heal yourself for an amount equal to the missing amount on the die.
If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a following turn of yours to attempt to afflict the disease on to a new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the die used for the spell increases in size by one for each slot level above 2nd, up to a {@dice d12} at 6th level.

spell.name: Wave of Terror
entries: As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a shroud of darkness covers the area affected by the spell, as wailing voices and faces with expressions of terror accompany the dark magic. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} of you. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of it's turns, ending the effect on a success.
On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a bonus action, you endow a willing creature with a surrounding magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from the target in every direction, but not through total cover. The aura lasts for the duration of the spell, or until the affected target is {@condition incapacitated}. You can dismiss the spell at any time as a bonus action.

The aura grants the target advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks but disadvantage on all other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 2d4} poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the poison damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Essence Abduction
entries: A cloud of life draining necrotic energy the size of one square emanates from you towards a direction, travelling in a 5 foot wide line up to 30 feet away, striking all creatures in its path. Each creature affected must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures who fail the saving throw take {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one.
After traveling, the cloud persists at its destination until the beginning of your next turn. During this time, any creature that comes into contact with the cloud is subjected to its effect.

At the beginning of your next turn, the cloud travels back to you in a 5 foot wide line, as long as you are within 60 feet of it at the time, striking all creatures in its path once again. The cloud can not move through impassable terrain. If the cloud returns to you, you regain {@dice 2d4} hit points for each unique creature that failed the saving throw which the spell damaged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8}, and the healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Reprisal

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by a damaging spell or magical effect

entries: The spell absorbs some of the incoming magic, and uses it to retaliate against an enemy. When you cast this spell, you have resistance against the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. As part of the reaction, you also return some of the resisted magic against the enemy, or redirect it against another enemy within 60 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} damage of the triggering type on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Curse of Exhaustion
entries: You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. At the beginning of each of the creatures turns, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature suffers {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage and one stack of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, the curse ends, and all stacks of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell are removed.
A Remove Curse cast on the target ends this spell.

spell.name: Howl of Terror
entries: You let loose a terrifying howl which affects every creature within 20 feet that can hear you. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. A target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it can't be {@condition frightened}.
On a successful save, the creature shrugs off the effect, but it's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of it's next turn.

On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you, and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you. The creature doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of it's turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 10 or more, it also drops {@condition prone} after using it's reaction to move away from you.

spell.name: Summon Nightmare

m.text: the hoof of a pegasus worth at least 50 gp

entries: In a cloud of roiling smoke, a black nightmare horse appears from the shadow plane with its mane, tail, and hooves wreathed in flame. For the duration of the spell, you can ride the steed, and it will follow your verbal orders and directions. The creature uses the statistics for a Nightmare, but without the Ethereal Stride action.

While riding the Nightmare, you can use the Nightmare's speed to move on your own turn. The Nightmare can not move on its own, and does not have its own turns, but it can use its Hooves action immediately after your turn.
When the spell ends, the Nightmare immediately disappears, vanishing in a cloud of brimstone. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it, or if the Nightmare falls to 0 hit points.

spell.name: Magical Volley

components.m: one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon

entries: You conjure a large array of ammunition or thrown weapons as duplicates of the original and fire them high into the sky. The ammunition or thrown weapons then pelt a 20-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder within range. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity savin throw, taking {@damage 1d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage type is the same as that of the ammunition or weapon.
The pelted area on the ground also becomes difficult terrain until the beginning of your next turn, as the thrown weapons or ammunition linger for a moment before disappearing, stuck in the ground.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6}, and the radius of the cylinder increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Bursting Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, a forceful explosion strikes the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it. Each creature affected must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d10} force damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Enfeebling Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, an injection of magical enfeebling poison is accompanied with the attack. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d8} poison damage, and it deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the spell ends. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not enfeebled.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cordon of Arrows

components.m: four or more arrows or bolts

entries: You plant four pieces of nonmagical ammunition, {@item arrow|phb|arrows} or {@item crossbow bolt|phb|crossbow bolts}, in the ground within range and lay magic upon them to protect an area. Until the spell ends, whenever a creature other than you comes within 30 feet of the ammunition for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, one piece of ammunition flies up to strike it. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} piercing damage. The piece of ammunition is then destroyed. The spell ends when no ammunition remains.
When you cast this spell, you can designate any creatures you choose, and the spell ignores them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of ammunition that can be affected increases by two for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Conjure Barrage

components.m: one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon

entries: You throw a nonmagical weapon or fire a piece of nonmagical ammunition into the air to create a cone of identical weapons that shoot forward and then disappear. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is the same as that of the weapon or ammunition used as a component.

spell.name: Steel Wind Strike

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You flourish the weapon used in the casting and then vanish to strike like the wind. Choose up to five creatures you can see within range. Make a melee spell attack against each target. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 6d6} force damage.
You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

spell.name: Witch Bolt

components.m: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entries: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal {@damage 1d12} lightning damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|1-9|1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern

components.m: a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material

entries: You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor. Creatures can also repeat the saving throw to end the effect at the end of their turns.

spell.name: Blight
entries: Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.
If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw, it simply withers and dies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sapping Sting
entries: You sap the vitality of one creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage and fall {@condition prone}.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Detect Magic
entries: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: False Life

components.m: a small amount of alcohol or distilled spirits

entries: Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain {@dice 1d4 + 4} temporary hit points for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tenser's Floating Disk
entries: This spell creates a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3 feet above the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The disk remains for the duration, and can hold up to 500 pounds. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything on the disk falls to the ground.

The disk is immobile while you are within 20 feet of it. If you move more than 20 feet away from it, the disk follows you so that it remains within 20 feet of you. It can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like, but it can't cross an elevation change of 10 feet or more. For example, the disk can't move across a 10-foot-deep pit, nor could it leave such a pit if it was created at the bottom.
If you move more than 100 feet from the disk (typically because it can't move around an obstacle to follow you), the spell ends.

spell.name: Magic Mouth

m.text: a small bit of honeycomb and jade dust worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You implant a message within an object in range, a message that is uttered when a trigger condition is met. Choose an object that you can see and that isn't being worn or carried by another creature. Then speak the message, which must be 25 words or less, though it can be delivered over as long as 10 minutes. Finally, determine the circumstance that will trigger the spell to deliver your message.

When that circumstance occurs, a magical mouth appears on the object and recites the message in your voice and at the same volume you spoke. If the object you chose has a mouth or something that looks like a mouth (for example, the mouth of a statue), the magical mouth appears there so that the words appear to come from the object's mouth. When you cast this spell, you can have the spell end after it delivers its message, or it can remain and repeat its message whenever the trigger occurs.

The triggering circumstance can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30 feet of the object. For example, you could instruct the mouth to speak when any creature moves within 30 feet of the object or when a silver bell rings within 30 feet of it.

spell.name: Silence
entries: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on either a point, object, or item you choose within range. The spell can not be cast on on object or item worn or carried by an unwilling creature.

Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

spell.name: Feign Death
entries: You touch a willing creature and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

For the spell's duration, or until you use an action to touch the target and dismiss the spell, the target appears dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated}, and its speed drops to 0. The target has resistance to all damage except psychic damage. If the target is diseased or {@condition poisoned} when you cast the spell, or becomes diseased or {@condition poisoned} while under the spell's effect, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends.

spell.name: Evard's Black Tentacles

components.m: a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus or a giant squid

entries: Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until the spell ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tentacles takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

spell.name: Symbol

m.text: mercury, phosphorus, and powdered diamond and opal with a total value of at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a harmful glyph either on a surface (such as a section of floor, a wall, or a table) or within an object that can be closed to conceal the glyph (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest). If you choose a surface, the glyph can cover an area of the surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If you choose an object, that object must remain in its place; if the object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
The glyph is nearly {@condition invisible}, requiring an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC to find it.

You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. For glyphs inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or stepping on the glyph, removing another object covering it, approaching within a certain distance of it, or manipulating the object that holds it. For glyphs inscribed within an object, the most common triggers are opening the object, approaching within a certain distance of it, or seeing or reading the glyph.

You can further refine the trigger so the spell is activated only under certain circumstances or according to a creature's physical characteristics (such as height or weight), or physical kind (for example, the ward could be set to affect hags or shapechangers). You can also specify creatures that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password.

When you inscribe the glyph, choose one of the options below for its effect. Once triggered, the glyph glows, filling a 60-foot-radius sphere with dim light for 10 minutes, after which time the spell ends. Each creature in the sphere when the glyph activates is targeted by its effect, as is a creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

entries.name: Death
entries: Each target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Discord
entries: Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target bickers and argues with other creatures for 1 minute. During this time, it is incapable of meaningful communication and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Fear
entries: Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw and becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute on a failed save. While {@condition frightened}, the target drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the glyph on each of its turns, if able.

entries.name: Hopelessness
entries: Each target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is overwhelmed with despair for 1 minute. During this time, it can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects.

entries.name: Insanity
entries: Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target is driven insane for 1 minute. An insane creature can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish. The DM controls its movement, which is erratic.

entries.name: Pain
entries: Each target must make a Constitution saving throw and becomes {@condition incapacitated} with excruciating pain for 1 minute on a failed save.

entries.name: Sleep
entries: Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw and falls {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes on a failed save. A creature awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

entries.name: Stunning
entries: Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw and becomes {@condition stunned} for 1 minute on a failed save.

spell.name: Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting
entries: You draw the moisture from every creature in a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. Constructs and undead aren't affected, and plants and water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. A creature takes {@damage 12d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Nonmagical plants in the area that aren't creatures, such as trees and shrubs, wither and die instantly.

spell.name: Clone

m.text: a diamond worth at least 1,000 gp and at least 1 cubic inch of flesh of the creature that is to be cloned, which the spell consumes, and a vessel worth at least 2,000 gp that has a sealable lid and is large enough to hold the creature being cloned, such as a huge urn, coffin, mud-filled cyst in the ground, or crystal container filled with salt water

entries: This spell grows an inert duplicate of a living creature as a safeguard against death. This clone forms inside the vessel used in the spell's casting and grows to full size and maturity after 120 days; you can also choose to have the clone be a younger version of the same creature. It remains inert and endures indefinitely, as long as its vessel remains undisturbed.

At any time after the clone matures, if the original creature dies, its soul transfers to the clone, provided that the soul is free and willing to return. The clone is physically identical to the original and has the same personality, memories, and abilities, but none of the original's equipment. The original creature's physical remains, if they still exist, become inert and can't thereafter be restored to life, since the creature's soul is elsewhere.

spell.name: Maze
entries: You banish a creature that you can see within range into a labyrinthine demiplane. The target remains there for the duration or until it escapes the maze.

The target can use its action to attempt to escape. When it does so, it makes a DC 20 Intelligence check. If it succeeds, it escapes, and the spell ends (a {@creature minotaur} or {@creature goristro} demon automatically succeeds).
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Toll the Dead
entries: You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. If the target is {@condition wounded|farover}, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6} or {@damage 2d12}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6} or {@damage 3d12}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6} or {@damage 4d12}).

spell.name: Absorb Elements

time.condition: which you take when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: The spell captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee attack. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a weapon attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the triggering type, and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Chaos Bolt
entries: You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} damage. Choose one of the {@dice d6}s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.

If you roll the same number on the two first {@dice d6}s rolled, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.
A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, each target takes {@scaledamage 2d8 + 1d6|1-9|1d6} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Earth Tremor
entries: You cause a tremor in the ground within range. Each creature other than you in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Goodberry
entries: Up to five berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can use its action to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.

spell.name: Guiding Bolt
entries: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Healing Word
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 1d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Identify

m.text: a pearl worth at least 100 gp

entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. Make an {@skill Arcana} check when casting the spell. The DC to succeed is determined by the strength of the aura of the magical item (Faint: DC 13, Moderate: DC 16, Strong: DC 19, Overwhelming: DC 22). If you roll a natural 1 on the {@skill Arcana} check, the pearl used as the material component for the spell explodes into dust.

If the item is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object with an aura of faint strength, and you succeed on the {@skill Arcana} check, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.
Powerful magical items may have properties that are unidentifiable.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you similarly learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 3rd level, the spell can divine the properties of moderate magical items. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 5th level, the spell can divine the properties of strong magical items. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 7th level, the spell can divine the properties of overwhelming magical items.

spell.name: Inflict Wounds
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Jump
entries: You touch a creature. The creature's {@book jump distance|phb|8|Jumping} is tripled until the spell ends.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness
entries: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|1-9|1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile} spell

entries: An {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +3 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the AC bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Arcane Lock

m.text: gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes locked for the duration. The arcane lock serves as a "Hard Lock" for the purposes of lockpicking. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can open the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute.
Casting a {@spell knock} spell on the object suppresses {@spell arcane lock} for 10 minutes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 4th level, the arcane lock serves as an "Unbreakable Lock" for the purpose of lockpicking. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the arcane lock is immune to a {@spell knock} spell if the arcane lock was cast with a higher level spell slot than the {@spell knock}.

spell.name: Barkskin
entries: You touch a willing creature that is not wearing any armor made of metal. Until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target suffers 2 less damage from all sources.

spell.name: Healing Spirit
entries: You call forth a nature spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot cube you can see within range. The spirit looks like a transparent beast or fey (your choice).

Until the spell ends, whenever you or a creature you can see moves into the spirit's space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can cause the spirit to restore {@dice 1d6} hit points to that creature (no action required). The spirit can't heal constructs or undead. The spirit can heal a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of once). After healing that number of times, the spirit disappears.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the die size of the healing increases by one for every slot level above 2nd, up to {@dice 1d12} at 5th level.

spell.name: Heat Metal

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame

entries: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn. If a creature succeeds on this saving throw, they can no longer have disadvantage caused from this casting of heat metal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hold Person

components.m: a small, straight piece of iron

entries: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, and whenever the target takes damage, it can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Knock
entries: Choose an object that you can see within range. The object can be a door, a box, a {@item chest|phb}, a set of {@item manacles|phb}, a padlock, or another object that contains a mundane or magical means that prevents access. The lock must be the quality of an "Easy Lock" when it comes to lockpicking.
A target that is held shut by a easy lock or that is stuck or barred becomes unlocked, unstuck, or unbarred. If the object has multiple locks, only one of them is unlocked.

If you choose a target that is held shut with an {@spell arcane lock} spell cast at equal or lower level than the knock, the {@spell arcane lock} is suppressed for 10 minutes, during which time the target can be opened and shut normally.
When you cast the spell, a loud knock, audible from as far away as 300 feet, emanates from the target object.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of of 3rd level or higher, the spell can suppress an {@spell arcane lock} if the knock is cast at an equal or higher level.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 4th level, the spell can unlock medium locks. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 6th level, the spell can unlock hard locks. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of at least 8th level, the spell can unlock "unbreakable" locks.

spell.name: Invisibility

components.m: an eyelash encased in gum arabic

entries: A creature you touch becomes {@condition invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks, casts a spell, or takes any damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Prayer of Healing
entries: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4}. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 2d4|2-9|1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Snilloc's Snowball Swarm

components.m: a piece of ice or a small white rock chip

entries: A flurry of magic snowballs erupts from a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Spiritual Weapon
entries: You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. The attack rolls of the spiritual weapon do not benefit from any circumstantial benefits, such as flanking. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|2,4,6,8|1d8} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Catnap
entries: You make a calming gesture, and up to three willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range fall {@condition unconscious} for the spell's duration. The spell ends on a target early if it takes damage or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. If a target remains {@condition unconscious} for the full duration, that target gains the benefit of a short rest, and it can't be affected by this spell again until it finishes a long rest. Additionally, the next time a target takes a normal short rest, they gain no benefits from it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional willing creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 5 + the target spellcaster's level + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 5 + the spell's level + the either the target creature's level if cast on a creature, or the spellcaster's level if cast on an object.
On a successful check, the spell or magical effect ends.

spell.name: Fireball

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 6d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Haste
entries: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it. The target creature also {@table Aging Effects|farover|magically ages one year} during the spell.

spell.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
entries: A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell ends if you leave its area.

Nine creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than nine creatures. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside.
Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is transparent, and creatures outside and inside can see through it clearly.

spell.name: Nondetection

m.text: a pinch of diamond dust worth 10 gp sprinkled over the target, which the spell consumes

entries: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from divination magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. For the spells duration, the target can't be communicated with telepathically, or targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

spell.name: Phantom Steed
entries: A Large quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, but it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The creature uses the statistics for a {@creature riding horse}, except it has a speed of 100 feet and can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace. When the spell ends, the steed immediately vanishes, and the rider must use its reaction to land on its feet. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the steed takes any damage.

spell.name: Remove Curse
entries: At your touch, all curses of faint and moderate potency affecting one creature or object end.

spell.name: Slow
entries: You alter time around creatures of your choice in a 30-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. If the creature is normally able to make more than one attack per turn, it can take one less attack.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

spell.name: Gravity Sinkhole
entries: A 20-foot-radius sphere of crushing force forms at a point you can see within range and tugs at the creatures there. Each creature in the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d10} force damage and is pulled in a straight line toward the center of the sphere, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible (even if that space is in the air). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d10|4-9|1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Greater Invisibility
entries: You or a creature you touch becomes {@condition invisible} until the spell ends. If the target of the spell takes any damage, the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the target's person.

spell.name: Polymorph
entries: This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be {@filter any beast|bestiary|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm} whose challenge rating is equal to or less than 3/4ths the target's level (or equal to or less than its full challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and any damage the new form takes is also taken by the normal form, but only up to an amount that would reduce the creature to one hit point. If the target reverts to its normal form as a result of the new form dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form, even if it would bring the normal form to below one hit point.
The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

spell.name: Stoneskin

m.text: diamond dust worth 100 gp

entries: This spell turns the flesh of a willing creature you touch as hard as stone. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
If the spell is cast on the caster themselves, the caster does not need to make Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on stoneskin.

spell.name: Vitriolic Sphere

components.m: a drop of giant slug bile

entries: You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot-diameter ball of emerald acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 8d4} acid damage and another {@damage 5d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d4|4-9|2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Commune

m.text: incense and a vial of holy or unholy water worth at least 50gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You contact your deity or a divine proxy with one question that can be answered with a yes or no. You must ask your question before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for the question.

Divine beings aren't necessarily omniscient, so you might receive "unclear" as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity's knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity's interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative {@chance 75|25 percent} chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer. The DM makes this roll in secret.

spell.name: Contact Other Plane
entries: You mentally contact a demigod, the spirit of a long-dead sage, or some other mysterious entity from another plane. Contacting this extraplanar intelligence can strain or even break your mind. When you cast this spell, make a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, you take {@damage 6d6} psychic damage and are insane until you finish a long rest. While insane, you can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speak only in gibberish. A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on you ends this effect.

On a successful save, you can ask the entity one question. You must ask your question before the spell ends. The DM answers the question with one word, such as "yes," "no," "maybe," "never," "irrelevant," or "unclear" (if the entity doesn't know the answer to the question). If a one-word answer would be misleading, the DM might instead offer a short phrase as an answer.

spell.name: Greater Restoration

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's {@condition exhaustion} level by three, or end one of the following effects on the target:

items: One effect that {@condition charmed} or {@condition petrified} the target
One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

spell.name: Scrying

m.text: a focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water

entries: You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The base DC for succeeding is 10 + the target creature's level (or 3/4 of its challenge rating). The DC is also modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can let you automatically succeed on the ability check.

entries.caption: Knowledge of Target
rows: Secondhand (you have heard of the target)

entries.caption: Connection to Target
rows: Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like

entries: On a failed ability check, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.
